title: RICE Method for Treating Sprains
brief: The RICE protocol for treating sprains: Rest, Ice, Compression, and Elevation.
steps: Apply ice for first 24 hours, then switch to heat after that.
Apply compression wrapping and/or splinting to help stabilize the injury.
If possible, leave boot on sprained ankle unless circulation is compromised.
Elevate the affected area above heart level when possible.
warnings: Remove boot only if circulation is compromised
Do not apply heat for first 24 hours
Watch for signs of circulation problems
